item.title: Senior Technical Product Support Engineer 7578 (redwood city)
item.description:
If you are interested and qualified for this posititon, please apply on-line at our website at the following web link:

http://www.openwave.com/us/careers/search_jobs.htm?locale=en-us&cpUrl=http%3A%2F%2Fcareers.peopleclick.com%2Fcareerscp%2FClient_Openwave%2Fexternal%2Fgateway.do%3FfunctionName%3DviewFromLink%26jobPostId%3D6779%26localeCode%3Den-us

Position Description

Openwave is looking for a talented, ambitious candidate to join our Technical Product Support team.
The Senior Technical Product Support engineer will be appointed as a technical support liaison to specified customers and will become the primary support contact for those customers. You will engage in regular communication with customers to cover issue status, obtain details of upcoming technical activity, develop and maintain excellent working relationships and promote customer satisfaction. You may also be appointed as a technical support liaison to specified partners and will then become the primary support contact and will manage them through partner certification programs. As a senior engineer, you will service as a technical subject matter expert within the team assisting and guiding other engineers in problem resolution.



Responsibilities will include:

Ownership of allocated technical support issues through to resolution, escalating when necessary.
Become a point of technical expertise within the team; assist and guide engineers in the execution of their duties and problem resolution.
Creating, managing, and supporting cases in the case tracking system.
Log bugs in the bug tracking system while providing all reasonable data to the Product Group to assist in resolving the issue.
Ability to write tools/scripts to assist in trouble-shooting/support activities and maintain those scripts in a tools repository.
Create knowledge base documentation for all resolved issues if none exist. Review existing knowledge base documents, ensuring they are technically valid, clear, grammatically correct and presentable.
Monitor partner workloads and assess their ability to provide end-customer support, identifying areas of strength and weakness. Assist in training the partnerÂ’s technical support group to ensure support of the highest quality is afforded to the end-customer.
Participate in an on-call rotation. On-call duties will consist of pager support including public holidays.
Travel to customer sites as needed.

Position Requirements

Position Requirements

5 years experience in the technical support arena in a software and/or Telco environment.
Proven technical expertise in messaging and/or internet technologies with demonstrated problem solving skills and the ability to articulate and present technical solutions to address business problems.
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal with the ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships at all levels externally and internally.
Easily adaptable, flexible, able to work well under pressure and manage critical situations
Operationally driven and experienced in a results-driven environment. Very customer oriented, self-motivated and strong team player.
BS in Computer Science or Engineering


Technical Requirements

5 years experience in the technical support arena.
Experience in a software and/or Telco environment.
Familiarity of mobile/messaging protocols and markup languages such as HTTP, Radius, SMPP, SMTP, HTML and Javascript.
Scripting experience in shell, Perl, and/or Python.
Experience with programming languages such as C++ and/or Java.
Unix System Administration experience (7-10 years) such as Solaris, Linux, and/or AIX. Certifications a plus.
High Availability solutions such as Veritas Cluster Server, Sun Cluster, and/or IBM HACMP
Database/SQL experience such as Oracle, Db2, and/or mysql. Certification a plus.
Network experience with firewalls, routers, switches, and load balancers such as Nortel, F5, and/or Cisco. Certification a plus.
Proven technical expertise in email, mobile messaging and/or mobile internet technologies with demonstrable problem solving skills and the ability to articulate and present technical solutions to address business problems.

Company Description

Openwave Systems Inc. (Nasdaq: OPWV) is the leading independent provider of open software products and services for the communications industry. Openwave's breadth of products, including mobile phone software, multimedia messaging software (MMS), email, location and mobile gateways, along with its worldwide expertise enable its customers to deliver innovative and differentiated data services. Openwave is a global company headquartered in Redwood City, California. For more information please visit www.openwave.com.
